[woman] Oh goodness.

translation.en: And I really felt like, if anyone was gonna break through the mire

translation.ja: 皆 同じことを目指していました

translation.en: getting Falcon 1 to orbit.

translation.en: On the fuel side, we're gonna add a port rather than mess with the valve.

translation.en: It's just a monumental amount of work.

translation.en: [Hans] It's extremely difficult to build a rocket from scratch.

translation.ja: ロケットが打ち上がると１段目は燃焼します

translation.en: and the second stage ignites to get to orbit.
translation.ja: ２段目は軌道へ向かいます

translation.en: And rockets are unforgiving.

translation.en: One design error, and… and everything is… is over.

translation.en: Curtains if we didn't make it in three flights.

translation.ja: ４年かけて開発に取り組みました

translation.en: I had no doubts ever.

translation.en: I was just so focused on building the company and… and getting… getting the rocket to fly.

translation.en: [officer 1] Five, four, three, two, one, zero.
Plus one, plus two, plus three, plus four,

translation.en: plus five, plus six, plus seven,
translation.ja: プラス５ プラス６プラス７

translation.en: This is the LC on the countdown net.

translation.ja: 翌日 部品を集める作業は苦痛でした

translation.en: We'd worked on it for years, and suddenly everything was over.
translation.ja: 長年かけて開発したのに一瞬で終わりました

translation.ja: 私は妻と ２ヶ月口を利かなかったようです

translation.en: I had… It took me… It took me so long to just get over this and… and… and collect myself
translation.ja: 気を取り直し２号機に取りかかるまで

translation.en: and then continue working on… on rocket number two.
translation.ja: かなりの時間を要しました

translation.en: [officer] Five, four, three, two, one.
[Hans] A year later, our second attempt failed.

translation.ja: さらに１年後３回目の飛行も失敗します

translation.en: 'cause it… it seemed pretty, pretty dark.
translation.ja: 当時はかなり不安定でした

translation.en: [Hans] I was pretty depressed at the time.
translation.ja: かなり落ち込みました

translation.en: You know, three failures in a row,

translation.en: um, wasn't really a testament of… of great engineering.
translation.ja: エンジニアとして自信を失います

translation.en: Elon pulled us in a big conference room,

translation.en: and I expected him to say, "You guys suck," and stop it at this point,

translation.en: He was actually saying, "I want you guys to fix everything
translation.ja: 実際は“問題点を改善し”

translation.en: [Bala] Weather is very, you know, fickle in Florida.
translation.ja: スペースＸ飛行安全ディレクターフロリダの天候は不安定です フロリダの天候は不安定です フロリダの天候は不安定ですバラ･ラママーシー

translation.en: Some of the most intense lightning I've seen in the world
translation.ja: バラ･ラママーシーケープカナベラルでは激しい雷が発生します ケープカナベラルでは激しい雷が発生します

translation.en: happens at Cape Canaveral.

translation.en: [Bala] In addition to all those weather factors,

translation.en: We're basically loading, like, a million pounds of, like, fuel and oxygen

translation.en: -Have a great launch. -[Jim] My pleasure. Thank you.
translation.ja: これで以上です ありがとう

translation.en: -Hey, this is huge. -[cameraman] We got more down there.
translation.ja: 有り難いね もっとあります

translation.en: Gets me through the day. -[cameraman laughs] -I'm very grateful.
translation.ja: これで１日を乗り切れる

translation.en: [Hans] It's not too bad.
translation.ja: 悪くない

translation.en: I mean…
translation.ja: たぶん

translation.en: …it's a mess, but at least it's… It has a chance to clear up.
translation.ja: まだ晴れる可能性はあります

translation.en: [Jim] The big thing right now is isolated thunderstorms.
translation.ja: 雷雨が発生していますが

translation.en: The question is, is it gonna be sufficiently problematic to where we… we can't launch?
translation.ja: 打ち上げが困難なほどかどうかが問題です

translation.en: Um, right now, I'm being told fifty-fifty.
translation.ja: 可能性は50％です

translation.en: Hi, it's me, Tim Dodd, the Everyday Astronaut.
translation.ja: ティム･ドッドだ

translation.en: I'm three miles away, looking at the rocket right now.
translation.ja: ロケットから５キロの場所にいる

translation.en: The weather is starting to clear up here a little bit,
translation.ja: 天気は少し 晴れてきた

translation.en: but I can tell you, based on the amount of people,
translation.ja: 人の多さを見ても

translation.en: this is definitely the launch to watch for the year, guys.
translation.ja: 今年一番 注目される打ち上げになるね

translation.en: Now, just waiting to hear what's gonna happen.
translation.ja: 最終判断を待ってるところだ

translation.en: My name is Jessie Anderson.
translation.ja: 〝ダグ･ハーリーボブ･ベンケン〞 〝ダグ･ハーリーボブ･ベンケン〞 私はスペースＸのエンジニアですが

translation.en: I'm a lead manufacturing engineer here at SpaceX,
translation.ja: 〝ダグ･ハーリーボブ･ベンケン〞 私はスペースＸのエンジニアですが 私はスペースＸのエンジニアですが

translation.en: and I speak for all of us when I say we could not be more excited
translation.ja: これ以上ないほど興奮しています

translation.en: to finally be sending humans to the International Space Station.
translation.ja: ついにＩＳＳに人類を送れるのです

translation.en: It's a great day.
translation.ja: 最高の日です

translation.en: Today's mission is known as Demonstration Mission-2.
translation.ja: 今回 行われるのはＤｅｍｏ２ミッション

translation.en: It's gonna be the first time a commercially built spacecraft will launch people to the space station.
translation.ja: 民間企業の有人ロケットがＩＳＳに行くのは初です

translation.en: Demo-2 is an end-to-end flight test, from launch all the way to docking,
translation.ja: Ｄｅｍｏ２は打ち上げから着水までを

translation.en: and ending with splashdown.
translation.ja: テストします

translation.en: And it's the final test for NASA to certify SpaceX
translation.ja: スペースＸとＮＡＳＡによる

translation.en: for regular crew flights to the space station.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳへの定期飛行の最終テストです

translation.en: [Gwynne] I don't get nervous for launches. I don't get nervous for doing speaking gigs.
translation.ja: 打ち上げや講演会では緊張しません

translation.en: Starting a month ago or so, I started getting nervous for this launch.
translation.ja: しかし今回は緊張しています

translation.en: I shouldn't have eaten breakfast.
translation.ja: 朝食を抜けばよかった

translation.en: [man] It's a stress-eating kind of day.
translation.ja: ストレスで食べるよね

translation.en: And then yesterday was tough, and today, just forget it.
translation.ja: 昨日は仕事が忙しかったのですが 今日は何も手につきません

translation.en: Hard to get any work done at all today.
translation.ja: 今日は何も手につきません

translation.en: I always worry about the things that we don't know about.
translation.ja: 先の分からないことを心配しがちです

translation.en: Launch makes you superstitious.
translation.ja: 迷信的になります

translation.en: It's called launch juju. Um, I don't know where that term came from.
translation.ja: “打ち上げジュジュ(魔術)”と呼び

translation.en: I think it's an Air Force term actually, but people do very odd things.
translation.ja: 起源は不明ですが皆 変な行動を取ります

translation.en: [man] So here's my Dragon socks.
translation.ja: ドラゴンソックスだ

translation.en: Cool launch-day socks is my ritual.
translation.ja: 打ち上げの時に履く

translation.en: [Hans] I don't look at the mission sticker. I can't look at it before we fly.
translation.ja: 飛行前はミッションステッカーを見られない

translation.en: [woman] I will wear red sometimes when it's really important.
translation.ja: 大事な時は赤色を着る

translation.en: Don't wear red on launch day. -Really? -Red means "no go." Don't wear it.
translation.ja: 赤はダメ“中止”の意味だから

translation.en: Wearing green would be extra good luck.
translation.ja: 緑色がいいよ

translation.en: Hans has got it figured out.
translation.ja: ハンスが着てる

translation.en: I call it the launch beard. Like, you know, it grows out.
translation.ja: 打ち上げの時はヒゲを生やして

translation.en: And then day of the launch, it cleans up.
translation.ja: 翌日にそる

translation.en: I usually have a beard, but if we don't launch more than two days in a row, I shave the beard.
translation.ja: 連続２日以上打ち上げがないと髭をそる

translation.en: [Bala] Why is that?
translation.ja: なぜ？

translation.en: Just so that we can launch on the third day.
translation.ja: ３日目に打ち上げるためだ

translation.en: [Gwynne] I was in Scotland for the first time we got to orbit, so for every launch,
translation.ja: 初めて軌道に乗せた時はスコットランドにいたから

translation.en: I put stickies in my shoe that say "Scotland" on it.
translation.ja: “スコットランド”のメモを靴に貼ってる

translation.en: So I am always in Scotland when we launch.
translation.ja: 打ち上げの時はいつもスコットランドにいる

translation.en: [man] Are you a very superstitious person?
translation.ja: いつもこうですか？

translation.en: I'm not at all, uh, except for this.
translation.ja: 今回だけね

translation.en: I think we've pounded flat the risks that we understand and the risks we know about,
translation.ja: 確認できるリスクは排除してきました

translation.en: and I really hope we do the right thing by Doug and Bob
translation.ja: ボブとダグが無事にＩＳＳへ行けることを

translation.en: and get them to the space station safely
translation.ja: 心から願っています

translation.en: and inspire generations to come.
translation.ja: 次世代を鼓舞させたいです

translation.en: Really, we just can't fuck it up. [laughs]
translation.ja: 失敗はできません

translation.en: That's the most important thing about today.
translation.ja: 一番 重要なことね

translation.en: No fucking it up.
translation.ja: 失敗はダメ

translation.en: [Jim] This is my second one.
translation.ja: 〝Ｄｅｍｏ２打ち上げ日〞 これは２本目

translation.en: That was my first. So I don't know, is that like three? I don't know.
translation.ja: あれも空だから３本目か？

translation.en: [man 1] Okay, Jim, we have the, uh, official weather update.
translation.ja: ジム 天気予報が更新された

translation.en: The cell that they're worried about has moved to the north.
translation.ja: 問題視してた雷雨は北へ移動した

translation.en: -So we're go for launch. -[Jim] Fantastic.
translation.ja: 決行だ 現場へ向かおう

translation.en: -So we're gonna head over. -[man 2] Yes.
translation.ja: 現場へ向かおう

translation.en: Big day, sir.
translation.ja: いよいよ

translation.en: -[Jim] It is. -[man 1] Yeah, it is.
translation.ja: そうだな

translation.en: [Jim] I think anybody who's been involved in this for the last decade
translation.ja: この10年間関わってきた人たちは

translation.en: has got to be on the edge of their seat right now.
translation.ja: 皆 手に汗を握っているでしょう

translation.en: This agency has had many, many tough times in the past…
translation.ja: 多くの試練を乗り越えてきました

translation.en: but for Bob and Doug's launch today,
translation.ja: ボブとダグの打ち上げのため

translation.en: we've done everything we can.
translation.ja: 全力を尽くしました

translation.en: There comes that moment when you say, "Okay, now is the time."
translation.ja: ついに この時がやってきたのです

translation.en: [Jessie] Here they come, NASA astronauts Bob Behnken and Doug Hurley.
translation.ja: 来ました ＮＡＳＡ宇宙飛行士のボブとダグです

translation.en: They've each made this journey twice before.
translation.ja: 両者 ３度目の宇宙飛行です

translation.en: [male host] There's Megan and Karen and their sons.
translation.ja: メーガンとカレン息子たちです

translation.en: -I love you. -[boy] I love you, Dad.
translation.ja: 愛してるよ 僕も

translation.en: Here's my big hug. Here comes the big hug.
translation.ja: エアハグだ

translation.en: Oh, squeeze.
translation.ja: ぎゅうっとね

translation.en: [Doug] When you're saying goodbye to your family, you really realize
translation.ja: 家族に別れを告げると痛感します

translation.en: that there's more to it than just a rocket going up. That there's… There can be consequences.
translation.ja: 宇宙に行ってしまえば二度と会えないかもしれない

translation.en: [Bob] To see your parent launch on the rocket,
translation.ja: 親がロケットに乗る姿を見るなんて…

translation.en: it's scary for a small kid.
translation.ja: 子どもは怖いはず

translation.en: The first time we shared it with him,
translation.ja: 当初の息子の反応は

translation.en: his opinion was, you know, "Daddy can't go to space."
translation.ja: “パパ 宇宙に行かないで”でした

translation.en: That's something I wasn't quite, uh, prepared for.
translation.ja: 予期せぬ反応だったため

translation.en: I didn't expect to… to have that hit me as much as it did.
translation.ja: 私は想像以上に動揺しました

translation.en: [woman] And we are following the convoy as they continue to make their way to the pad.
translation.ja: 輸送車隊が発射台に向かっています

translation.en: These people have been working long hours.
translation.ja: 関係者は長時間 働き

translation.en: Coronavirus happened, and we made it.
translation.ja: コロナにも負けず今日を迎えました

translation.en: And here they come.
translation.ja: 来ました

translation.en: Just minutes from now, the astronauts will climb into Dragon.
translation.ja: あと数分で搭乗が開始されます

translation.en: [man] It's a beautiful view up there, too, of getting ready for the business at hand of heading to the cosmos.
translation.ja: 宇宙へ向かうのにふさわしい美しい眺めです

translation.en: [technician] We're gonna make sure all your zippers are closed, minus your gloves.
translation.ja: 宇宙服の最終確認をします

translation.en: Good?
translation.ja: いいですか？

translation.en: [man 1] Does it feel like this line is gonna move? And then this will kind of move off.
translation.ja: ここの雨雲のラインは動くと思う？

translation.en: [man 2] This should subside anything behind it.
translation.ja: 横にずれると思う

translation.en: -Okay. -[man 2] Probably a couple hours.
translation.ja: ２時間ほどで ２時間ほどでスペースＸ 打ち上げ･回収ディレクター スペースＸ 打ち上げ･回収ディレクター

translation.en: I think if we can get Elon here. I just wanna make sure he's in the loop.
translation.ja: スペースＸ 打ち上げ･回収ディレクターイーロンにも情報共有したい イーロンにも情報共有したい イーロンにも情報共有したいキコ･ドンチェフ イーロンにも情報共有したい

translation.en: [Elon] I just wanna double-check. Who's doing the measurement?
translation.ja: 再確認だが誰が測定を？

translation.en: [Kiko] The Range.
translation.ja: 空軍です

translation.en: Yeah, great, but who at the Range?
translation.ja: 具体的に誰が？

translation.en: Uh, the Launch Weather Officer. Basically, the whole weather office.
translation.ja: 打ち上げ時の気象観測の担当者です

translation.en: They're the ones that basically make the call on the Range weather.
translation.ja: そこの組織が長期予報を出します

translation.en: Mike's gonna call it right now.
translation.ja: 今 判定が出ます

translation.en: [Mike] Dragon, SpaceX. Weather is go at this time.
translation.ja: ドラゴン 天気は問題なし

translation.en: Dragon copy. Go weather.
translation.ja: 了解 天気は大丈夫

translation.en: [Mike] Dragon, SpaceX. You are go for section seven. Close visors and arm launch escape system.
translation.ja: ドラゴン バイザーを閉じ脱出システムをオンに

translation.en: Visors coming closed.
translation.ja: バイザーを閉じる

translation.en: 7.2, our visors are closed, and we're arming the launch escape system.
translation.ja: バイザーを閉じた脱出システムを入れる

translation.en: [officer 1] Launch escape system is verified armed.
translation.ja: 脱出システムの装備を確認

translation.en: [launch director] Launch director to countdown net, poll is complete,
translation.ja: カウントダウン担当者

translation.en: and we have a go to proceed with propellant load.
translation.ja: 推進燃料の搭載を

translation.en: [officer 2] Propellant load has started.
translation.ja: 燃料搭載を開始

translation.en: [launch director] Dragon, SpaceX launch director.
translation.ja: ドラゴン スペースＸ

translation.en: 2D to violate a couple of weather rules
translation.ja: 天気の違反があり

translation.en: that now do not expect to clear in time for launch.
translation.ja: 打ち上げまでに解除されそうにない

translation.en: Proceed to 2D launch abort sequence, please.
translation.ja: 打ち上げ中止の手続きを

translation.en: [Bob] We copy. We can see some raindrops on the windows,
translation.ja: 了解　窓から雨粒が見える

translation.en: and it's just part of the deal.
translation.ja: やむをえない

translation.en: [Mike] Copy all.
translation.ja: 了解

translation.en: [Kiko] That's it.
translation.ja: 無理です

translation.en: -It's aborted? -[Kiko] Yeah.
translation.ja: 中止か？

translation.en: It's not our day.
translation.ja: 今日じゃない

translation.en: Basically, we've got ten major weather rules,
translation.ja: 10個ほどの天候規則があり

translation.en: and three of them are in violation right now.
translation.ja: ３つに違反してます

translation.en: -Three? -Yeah.
At least eyeballing it, this does not look like we should be stopping launch.
translation.ja: 中止するほどには見えないな

translation.en: We wanna make sure we're not scrubbing based on half-hour-old weather.
translation.ja: 古い情報じゃないのか

translation.en: [man] The measurement's real-time… it's real-time lightning.
translation.ja: リアルタイムの気象情報です

translation.en: -[Elon] Okay. -[man] Yeah.
translation.ja: 分かった

translation.en: We just wanna make sure it's real and we're not jumping at shadows.
translation.ja: 確実な情報源が必要だ

translation.en: Okay.
translation.ja: はい

translation.en: [Kiko] So next launch time is Saturday.
translation.ja: 打ち上げは土曜に

translation.en: [Elon] Okay.
translation.ja: 分かった

translation.en: [Kiko] I… am bummed.
translation.ja: がっかりです

translation.en: -[chuckling] Yes, I am bummed too. -[Kiko laughing]
translation.ja: 僕もだ

translation.en: I, too, am bummed. Yes.
translation.ja: 僕も同じ気持ちだ

translation.en: I am too.
translation.ja: ええ

translation.en: [Mike] Dragon, SpaceX. Thanks for the valiant effort today. Appreciate your resilience.
translation.ja: ドラゴン スペースＸご理解に感謝します

translation.en: [Doug] Yeah, we appreciate those words.
translation.ja: お気遣いありがとう

translation.en: Everybody did great today, and we'll do it again on Saturday.
translation.ja: 皆 頑張ってくれた土曜に再挑戦だ

translation.en: [woman] Today, we're giving it another shot.
translation.ja: 本日 再挑戦です

translation.en: Wednesday's first attempt was postponed due to that wild weather,
translation.ja: 水曜は中止になりましたが本日 成功すれば

translation.en: but if all goes well today, we will mark a new first
translation.ja: 水曜は中止になりましたが本日 成功すれば 史上初の民間企業による有人宇宙飛行となります

translation.en: and usher in the commercial-crew era of American spaceflight.
translation.ja: 史上初の民間企業による有人宇宙飛行となります

translation.en: [Doug] To get an actual scrub, it really was almost like a gift.
translation.ja: 延期になったことはある意味 幸運です

translation.en: It was just one last chance
translation.ja: 最後にもう１度

translation.en: to go through and evaluate and make sure everything's ready to fly.
translation.ja: 打ち上げの準備が万全か確認できました

translation.en: But from an emotional standpoint, it was extremely difficult.
translation.ja: しかし 感情を整理するのは大変でした

translation.en: My son, Jack, was really hit pretty hard when we scrubbed.
translation.ja: 延期と聞いて 息子のジャックは動揺しました

translation.en: Karen said he kind of went and sat in a chair
translation.ja: カレンが言うには彼は 独りになりたがったようです

translation.en: and just wanted to be by himself.
translation.ja: 独りになりたがったようです

translation.en: He kind of gets that there's a lot that can go wrong.
translation.ja: 危険がたくさんあると感じたのでしょう

translation.en: He had already said goodbye to me,
translation.ja: すでにしたお別れを

translation.en: and I… I think he probably didn't wanna have to go through that again.
translation.ja: 再び経験するのは嫌だったのでしょう

translation.en: Hey, buddy, I love you.
translation.ja: 愛してるよ

translation.en: You bet. This is gonna be cool.
translation.ja: きっと大丈夫だ

translation.en: Be good for Mommy.
translation.ja: ママによろしく

translation.en: See you, buddy.
translation.ja: じゃあね

translation.en: [Bob] Hey, Theo, you be on good behavior, okay?
translation.ja: テオ いい子にするんだぞ

translation.en: And enjoy today. Watch the rocket for me, okay?
translation.ja: パパのロケットを見届けてくれ

translation.en: I'll call you from the space station.
translation.ja: 宇宙から電話する

translation.en: Okay, you're welcome.
translation.ja: 分かったよ

translation.en: I love you.
translation.ja: 愛してる

translation.en: To see your parent launch on a rocket
translation.ja: 親がロケットに乗るなんて

translation.en: is something that my son hasn't been exposed to.
translation.ja: 息子にとっては初めてです

translation.en: I needed to figure out a way to prepare him for that.
translation.ja: 彼には心の準備が必要でした

translation.en: This is, uh, Tremor.
translation.ja: これはトレマー

translation.en: Tremor is, uh… was actually my son's dinosaur.
translation.ja: 息子の恐竜のぬいぐるみです

translation.en: I decided to bring Tremor and take him through the entire process,
translation.ja: トレマーをミッションに連れて行くことで

translation.en: you know, to make it feel a little bit more normal for my son.
translation.ja: 息子に少しでも安心してもらいたいのです

translation.en: [officer 1] Core and countdown one in T-minus 2 hours and 46 minutes.
translation.ja: 打ち上げまで２時間46分です

translation.en: The crew has arrived at the White Room. Its ingress is in progress on schedule.
translation.ja: クルーは定刻どおりホワイトルームに搭乗

translation.en: [launch director] Launch Control, clear to retract the axis arm on time.
translation.ja: アクセスアームの格納を

translation.en: Crew access arm retract has started.
translation.ja: アクセスアームの格納開始

translation.en: [launch director] Launch director to countdown net, poll is complete,
translation.ja: カウントダウン担当者

translation.en: and we have a go to proceed with propellant load.
translation.ja: 推進燃料の搭載開始を

translation.en: [officer 2] Copy.
translation.ja: 了解

translation.en: [Kiko] What's up, Elon? Looking a little nicer today.
translation.ja: 今日の天気は良好です

translation.en: [Elon] It looks really nice.
translation.ja: 本当だな

translation.en: -Oh, palo santo. -[Elon] Yeah.
translation.ja: パロサントですか

translation.en: Like it. Anything you can do. [chuckles]
translation.ja: 頼れるものは何でも

translation.en: It's for good luck.
translation.ja: 幸運のため

translation.en: Situations like this, you can't have too much luck.
translation.ja: 何かに頼りたくなる

translation.en: [man] You believe in luck?
translation.ja: 幸運を信じる？

translation.en: [Elon] I believe luck is the best superpower.
translation.ja: 最高のスーパーパワーだ

translation.en: If you can have any superpower, luck is the one you'd want.
translation.ja: 幸運は最高の超能力だ

translation.en: [officer 3] Propellant fills are complete.
translation.ja: 燃料搭載 完了

translation.en: Falcon 9 is in startup. Dragon is in countdown.
translation.ja: ファルコン９起動カウントダウン開始

translation.en: FTS is armed for launch.
translation.ja: 自爆システム 装備

translation.en: All right.
translation.ja: よし

translation.en: Holy shit, here we go.
translation.ja: いよいよだ

translation.en: -Here we go. -[Elon sighs]
translation.ja: ですね

translation.en: [launch director] Dragon, SpaceX. Go for launch.
translation.ja: ドラゴン 打ち上げ開始

translation.en: SpaceX, Dragon. We're go for launch. Let's light this candle.
translation.ja: 打ち上げ開始だ点火しよう

translation.en: [officer 4] Ten, nine, eight, seven, six,
five, four, three, two, one, zero.
-Ignition. Liftoff. -[rumbling]
translation.ja: 発射

translation.en: -It's going. -Here we go.
translation.ja: 飛んだ 出た

translation.en: Stage one propulsion is nominal.
translation.ja: ステージ１ 順調に推進

translation.en: Falcon power telemetry nominal.
translation.ja: 動力も順調

translation.en: We're monitoring.
translation.ja: 監視中だ

translation.en: [officer] Vehicle is supersonic and passing through maximum dynamic pressure.
translation.ja: 超音速で最大動圧点を通過中

translation.en: [Bob] Copy one bravo.
translation.ja: 了解

translation.en: [launch director] And 1D throttle down.
translation.ja: １Ｄ 減速

translation.en: [Doug] Throttling down the Merlin engines.
translation.ja: マーリンエンジン減速

translation.en: [Kiko] Standing by for separation.
translation.ja: 分離に備えよ

translation.en: Dragon copy.
translation.ja: 了解

translation.en: [officer] Stage separation confirmed.
translation.ja: ステージ分離を確認

translation.en: [Kiko] First stage has done its job.
translation.ja: １段ステージ 任務完了

translation.en: Switch over to the second.
translation.ja: ２段目に切り替え

translation.en: Second stage ignited.
translation.ja: ２段ステージ 点火

translation.en: [Bob] SpaceX, Dragon. Thanks for the great ride to space.
translation.ja: スペースＸ ドラゴン宇宙に入りました

translation.en: Congratulations. We just put… we just put astronauts in orbit.
translation.ja: 宇宙飛行士を軌道に乗せた

translation.en: -Incredible. -Yeah!
translation.ja: おめでとう

translation.en: Yeah.
translation.ja: やった

translation.en: Well-done, guys.
translation.ja: お疲れ

translation.en: -Good work. -[man] That's awesome.
translation.ja: よくやった

translation.en: Congrats hug.
translation.ja: おめでとう

translation.en: That's real, dude. That's space!
translation.ja: 本当に宇宙を飛んでる

translation.en: [Elon] Wow. It only takes nine minutes to get to orbit.
translation.ja: 軌道に乗るのに９分

translation.en: Nine minutes, and you're going 25 times the speed of sound.
translation.ja: ９分で音速の25倍だ

translation.en: Bob and Doug--
translation.ja: ボブとダグは

translation.en: [Elon] Bob and Doug are cool as cucumbers.
translation.ja: ボブとダグは 落ち着いてるな

translation.en: [Kiko] Just hanging out. It looks too smooth.
translation.ja: くつろいでる 順調すぎる

translation.en: [Kiko] Two dads.
translation.ja: ２人のパパ

translation.en: Dads in space.
translation.ja: 宇宙のパパ

translation.en: [Doug] Well, everyone, kind of a tradition we've had with spacecraft, going way back to the Mercury era.
translation.ja: これはマーキュリー計画時代からの伝統だが

translation.en: We're given the honor to name this capsule.
translation.ja: 宇宙船に名前を付けられる

translation.en: Without further ado,
translation.ja: 早速だが

translation.en: we would like to, uh, welcome you aboard Capsule Endeavour.
translation.ja: この宇宙船を“エンデバー”と命名する

translation.en: [Bob] Uh, I'll tell you that for the ride uphill, while it was a… an exciting ride,
translation.ja: 宇宙まで打ち上がる工程は楽しかったが

translation.en: I think we got a… a couple of surprises
translation.ja: いくつか驚いた点もあった

translation.en: just in terms of the way the vehicle is kind of moving
translation.ja: いくつか驚いた点もあった 軌道に乗るために宇宙船はかなり揺れたし

translation.en: and… and shaking and taking you into orbit.
translation.ja: 軌道に乗るために宇宙船はかなり揺れたし

translation.en: You can tell that it's, uh… It's fighting against the Earth as it makes its way into space.
translation.ja: 宇宙へ向かうために地球と戦っているようだった

translation.en: We did, it turns out, end up with one stowaway
translation.ja: どうやらロケットの打ち上げ時に

translation.en: on board our, uh, vehicle when we launched today.
translation.ja: 密航者が入り込んだようだ

translation.en: I hope both of our sons were super excited to see, uh, their toy floating around with us on board.
translation.ja: 自分のおもちゃを見て息子たちも喜んでるはず

translation.en: I'm sure they would rather be here, given the opportunity,
translation.ja: 息子たちの代わりに

translation.en: but hopefully, they're proud of this as well.
translation.ja: 宇宙に来てくれた

translation.en: [Doug] So with that, I think it'll be good night from Capsule Endeavour.
translation.ja: カプセル･エンデバーからおやすみなさい

translation.en: Good night, Megan and Theo.
translation.ja: メーガン テオおやすみ

translation.en: And Karen and Jack.
translation.ja: カレンとジャックも

translation.en: [Elon] Thank you. Congratulations.
translation.ja: お疲れさま

translation.en: [Jim] We can breathe another sigh of relief.
translation.ja: ひと安心ですね

translation.en: [Elon] Indeed.
translation.ja: ああ

translation.en: [cameraman] You're good there?
translation.ja: 準備は？

translation.en: -He's left of the pole? Yeah? -[man] I gotcha.
translation.ja: 向かってる？ 了解

translation.en: [Jim] So far, everything has performed very, very well,
translation.ja: 今のところすべて順調に進んでいます

translation.en: and we are excited that Bob and Doug are safely in orbit
translation.ja: ダグとボブを無事に軌道に乗せることでき

translation.en: and on the way to the International Space Station.
translation.ja: 安心しています

translation.en: [reporter 1] Elon, what would you say to those who doubted SpaceX could do this? Do you have a message for them?
translation.ja: スペースＸの偉業を疑っていた人たちにひと言

translation.en: Do I have a message for those who…
translation.ja: 誰に対して…？

translation.en: -What? -[Jim] Who doubted you.
translation.ja: 何て？

translation.en: Oh, doubted. Okay. I was like, "What did he--?" Okay. Um…
translation.ja: 疑ってた人たちね

translation.en: Maybe I just blank out the word "doubt."
translation.ja: “疑う”が聞こえなかった

translation.en: No, I mean, I… To be totally frank, I doubted us too.
translation.ja: 自分でも疑ってました

translation.en: When starting SpaceX, I thought we maybe had a 10% chance of reaching orbit.
translation.ja: 当初は 成功確率は10％だと思っていましたが

translation.en: But fortunately, fate has smiled upon us and brought us to this day.
translation.ja: 幸い 運命は私たちにほほ笑んだ

translation.en: [reporter 2] Elon, you said that you had told Bob and Doug's boys
translation.ja: ボブとダグの息子たちに対して

translation.en: that you'd do everything you can to bring them home safely.
translation.ja: “パパを無事に帰す”と伝えましたね

translation.en: Even with a safe launch out of the way, that must still weigh on you,
translation.ja: １人の父親として どのようにお考えでしょうか？

translation.en: and I wondered what it's like as a dad.
translation.ja: どのようにお考えでしょうか？

translation.en: So, you know, uh, there's still…
translation.ja: まだこの先も…

translation.en: We still gotta dock with Space Station. We still gotta, uh… still gotta return.
translation.ja: ドッキングや帰還があります

translation.en: I think there's an argument that the return is more… more dangerous in some ways than the ascent.
translation.ja: 打ち上げより帰還の方が危険だという考えもあります

translation.en: So we don't wanna declare victory yet.
translation.ja: まだ勝利宣言はできない

translation.en: Anyway… I'm getting choked up here, so…
translation.ja: 言葉に詰まる質問ですね

translation.en: It… It's… Really, this…
translation.ja: これは本当に…

translation.en: Yeah, I don't… I'm getting choked up. Sorry.
translation.ja: すみません 言葉が出ない

translation.en: I'm not sure I can answer the question any more than that except, um…
translation.ja: これ以上は答えられない

translation.en: Yeah, we're gonna do everything we can to make sure it gets home safely.
translation.ja: 無事に帰すため全力を尽くします

translation.en: [Doug] Well, good morning, everyone, from, uh, Endeavour.
translation.ja: エンデバーからおはよう

translation.en: We, uh, had a great night. Got to get a little sleep.
translation.ja: 昨夜はよく眠れたよ

translation.en: And, uh, as you can see, a beautiful day pass right now.
translation.ja: ご覧のとおり美しい景色が見える

translation.en: Getting pretty close to ISS,
translation.ja: ＩＳＳにも近い

translation.en: uh, as we're flying at about 17,500 miles an hour around the planet.
translation.ja: 時速 約２万8000キロで地球上を周回してる

translation.en: [woman] Dragon, SpaceX. Comm check on big loop.
translation.ja: ドラゴン スペースＸ通信確認を

translation.en: [Doug] SpaceX, Dragon. Loud and clear now on the big loop.
translation.ja: スペースＸはっきり聞こえてる

translation.en: Good morning, Anna.
translation.ja: おはよう アナ

translation.en: [Anna] Good morning. Great to hear your voice.
translation.ja: 声を聞けてうれしい

translation.en: [Doug] It's great to hear yours as well.
translation.ja: 僕たちもだ

translation.en: We're looking forward to rendezvousing with Space Station today.
translation.ja: 今日はＩＳＳとの合流だ

translation.en: [Anna] I am responsible for being Bob and Doug's eyes and ears on the ground
translation.ja: 宇宙管制スペシャリストアナ･メノン私の仕事はボブとダグの地上の目と耳になること 私の仕事はボブとダグの地上の目と耳になること

translation.en: as they approach and then dock with the International Space Station.
translation.ja: これからＩＳＳに近づきドッキングします

translation.en: My role is to help make sure that they are informed of anything that's going awry,
translation.ja: 何か問題が起これば彼らに情報を伝えます

translation.en: and I am forever grateful to be a part of this moment.
translation.ja: この瞬間に立ち会えることに一生 感謝します

translation.en: One of my fourth-grade teachers was actually the daughter
translation.ja: 小学校の先生が チャレンジャー号の乗組員の娘でした

translation.en: of one of the astronauts on the Challenger.
translation.ja: チャレンジャー号の乗組員の娘でした

translation.en: She brought our class to NASA,
translation.ja: 当時 ＮＡＳＡに連れて来てもらってから

translation.en: and from that time on, I knew I wanted to be
translation.ja: 当時 ＮＡＳＡに連れて来てもらってから この仕事に就くのが夢でした

translation.en: a part of space operations.
translation.ja: この仕事に就くのが夢でした

translation.en: I still am amazed by how she… she ultimately changed my life,
translation.ja: 彼女は私の人生だけでなく 他の多くの人生にも影響を与えました

translation.en: and I imagine that she changed many other people's lives
translation.ja: 他の多くの人生にも影響を与えました

translation.en: as a result of something that had to have been incredibly painful for her.
translation.ja: 彼女にとっては苦痛の出来事だったでしょう

translation.en: Dragon, SpaceX.
translation.ja: ドラゴン スペースＸ

translation.en: Your rendezvous complete time is expected to be 1050 UTC.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳとの合流時刻は協定世界時 10時50分です

translation.en: [Bob] Copy.
translation.ja: 了解

translation.en: [Anna] As Dragon is approaching the space station,
translation.ja: スペースＸは超高速で

translation.en: it's flying at incredible speeds.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳに近づきます

translation.en: It first does a series of burns to get it in close proximity to the space station
translation.ja: まずは何度か燃焼してＩＳＳに接近します

translation.en: until the point at which it is basically in a straight line towards the docking adapter.
translation.ja: ドッキングアダプタの延長線上に来るまで続けます

translation.en: The whole time, we are watching our telemetry
translation.ja: 遠隔測定を行いドッキングアダプタに

translation.en: and making sure that when it gets to the docking adapter,
translation.ja: 遠隔測定を行いドッキングアダプタに 接続するタイミングを正確に見極めます

translation.en: it is precisely where it needs to be.
translation.ja: 接続するタイミングを正確に見極めます

translation.en: One problem, and it's a collision.
translation.ja: 問題は衝突の危険性です

translation.en: We face that risk, and we deal with that
translation.ja: 衝突回避のため

translation.en: by being extremely intentional in everything we do.
translation.ja: すべての行動に細心の注意を払います

translation.en: [man] Space Station on the big loop.
translation.ja: 宇宙ステーション

translation.en: Dragon, tally ho. I know you guys probably see it on the video cameras,
translation.ja: ドラゴン映像でも見えてるが

translation.en: but with the naked eye, we can see it as well.
translation.ja: 肉眼でも君たちが見える

translation.en: Looking like a nice, shiny new friend.
translation.ja: 光り輝いてるね

translation.en: Dragon copies. We'll be there in a second.
translation.ja: ドラゴン 了解数秒で着く

translation.en: [Anna] Dragon, SpaceX.
translation.ja: ドラゴン スペースＸ

translation.en: Ground is go for approach initiation.
translation.ja: 地上から接近開始を許可

translation.en: [Doug] Dragon on the big loop. We copy go.
translation.ja: ドラゴン 接近開始する

translation.en: [officer] Dragon, just 400 meters directly below station,
translation.ja: ＩＳＳの400メートル下から

translation.en: swinging itself up out in front to align itself with the docking adapter.
translation.ja: ドラゴンがドッキングアダプタに接近中

translation.en: [Anna] Dragon, SpaceX. Commanding hold.
translation.ja: ドラゴン 速度の維持を

translation.en: [Doug] Copy. We will command the hold.
translation.ja: 了解 速度を維持

translation.en: [officer] Dragon holding a little over 17,000 miles an hour,
translation.ja: ドラゴン時速 約２万7000キロで

translation.en: directly out in front of the space station.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳの前方に待機中

translation.en: [man] Space Station on the big loop. Crew on the International Space Station is ready for docking.
translation.ja: こちら宇宙ステーション我々はドッキング準備完了

translation.en: [Anna] Dragon, SpaceX. You are go to execute final approach.
translation.ja: ドラゴン スペースＸ最終接近の開始を

translation.en: [Doug] Copy. Go for docking.
translation.ja: 了解 ドッキング開始

translation.en: [Anna] We are following along with you.
translation.ja: 我々がついています

translation.en: [Doug] One hundred meters away from the space station.
translation.ja: 宇宙ステーションから100メートル

translation.en: [Anna] You know, as we were approaching the space station, I remember being extremely focused.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳに接近する時とても集中していました

translation.en: I had a checklist in my mind.
translation.ja: 頭にチェックリストがありました

translation.en: [Bob] We're inside 20 meters.
translation.ja: 残り20メートル

translation.en: [Anna] And I remember at one point, we were close to docking, and I looked up, and I saw Dragon.
translation.ja: ドッキングの途中にドラゴンの姿を見上げました

translation.en: I just had this moment of almost pinching myself that… that I couldn't believe this was happening.
translation.ja: これが現実だとは いまだに信じられませんでした

translation.en: I told myself this is… this is an incredibly special moment.
translation.ja: 私にとっては とてつもなく特別な瞬間でした

translation.en: [Bob] Three meters to go.
translation.ja: 残り３メートル

translation.en: Two meters.
translation.ja: ２メートル

translation.en: We are inside the hands-off point. One meter to go.
translation.ja: 間もなくドッキング残り１メートル

translation.en: [Anna] Dragon, SpaceX. Docking sequence is complete.
translation.ja: ドラゴン スペースＸドッキング完了

translation.en: Welcome to the International Space Station.
translation.ja: 国際宇宙ステーションへようこそ

translation.en: [man] Dragon arriving.
translation.ja: ドラゴンが到着

translation.en: The crew of Expedition 63 is honored to welcome
translation.ja: 第63次滞在クルーはドラゴンを

translation.en: Dragon and the commercial crew program aboard the International Space Station.
translation.ja: 第63次滞在クルーはドラゴンを ＩＳＳに迎え入れられて光栄だ

translation.en: Bob and Doug, glad to have you as part of the crew.
translation.ja: ボブとダグ ようこそ

translation.en: [officer] Aboard the International Space Station,
translation.ja: ＩＳＳの内部では

translation.en: Commander Chris Cassidy standing by in node two.
translation.ja: クリストファー･キャシディが待機中

translation.en: He does have two crew members on board, both Russian cosmonauts.
translation.ja: その隣は２人のロシア人宇宙飛行士

translation.en: He, uh, recently launched on the same Russian Soyuz spacecraft just a little more than a month ago.
translation.ja: １ヶ月ほど前にロシアのソユーズ船でやって来ました

translation.en: [Chris] And with that, Endeavour, welcome to the International Space Station.
translation.ja: エンデバーＩＳＳへようこそ

translation.en: Please come aboard.
translation.ja: どうぞ入って

translation.en: [Jim] Station, this is the NASA Administrator. Can you hear me?
translation.ja: こちらＮＡＳＡ聞こえますか？

translation.en: We hear you loud and clear, sir.
translation.ja: ええ はっきりと ええ はっきりとＩＳＳ第63次長期滞在クルー

translation.en: Welcome to the space station.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳ第63次長期滞在クルーＩＳＳへようこそ

translation.en: [Jim] Thank you, Chris. It's good to see you.
translation.ja: 会えてうれしいクリストファー･キャシディ

translation.en: And welcome to Bob and Doug.
translation.ja: クリストファー･キャシディボブとダグはお疲れさま ボブとダグはお疲れさま

translation.en: I will tell you, the whole world saw this mission,
translation.ja: 世界中が注目してる

translation.en: and we are so, so proud.
translation.ja: 誇りに思うよ

translation.en: I have a… a question for Chris.
translation.ja: クリスに質問だ

translation.en: Our crew here decided to be about three days late.
translation.ja: 打ち上げが３日遅れたが

translation.en: You gotta work them overtime, I presume now, to get them caught up on all the activities that they missed out on.
translation.ja: できなかった業務のために残業が必要かな？

translation.en: Well, the day they missed out on was a good one for them to skip.
translation.ja: 逃したのは大した予定ではありません

translation.en: It was Saturday housecleaning, and I… But I took care of it for 'em. We'll catch up next… next weekend.
translation.ja: 週末の清掃日でしたがまた来週やればいいだけです

translation.en: Uh, but in all seriousness,
translation.ja: でも真面目な話

translation.en: we're looking forward to some operational stuff later in the month. Maybe we'll get outside and do some space walks.
translation.ja: 今月の後半に船外活動を予定しています

translation.en: So we're… we're all super excited to have two more crewmates
translation.ja: 第63次クルーに２人加わり

translation.en: to the Expedition 63 team.
translation.ja: とても楽しみです

translation.en: [man] Station, this is James Corden with the CBS Late Late Show.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳの皆さんジェームズ･コーデンです

translation.en: How are you, gentlemen? Can you hear me?
translation.ja: 聞こえますか？

translation.en: James.
translation.ja: ジェームズ

translation.en: Welcome aboard the International Space Station.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳへようこそ

translation.en: We heard you loud and clear.
translation.ja: 聞こえますよ

translation.en: [James] How are you getting on up there? How are you doing? Are you okay?
translation.ja: 宇宙での生活はどうですか？

translation.en: [Doug] We're doing pretty good.
translation.ja: 順調です

translation.en: I think we're assimilating into the, uh, ISS life,
translation.ja: ＩＳＳの生活にも慣れてきて

translation.en: trying to help Chris out as much as we can.
translation.ja: クリスをサポートしてます

translation.en: [James] That's great. I'm jealous of both of you right now
translation.ja: 長年 無重力になりたかったから

translation.en: because I've spent most of my life wanting to be weightless.
translation.ja: 長年 無重力になりたかったから 嫉妬しちゃいます

translation.en: Tell me, what's the best and worst thing
translation.ja: 毎日 無重力空間で生活する―

translation.en: about living life in zero gravity every day?
translation.ja: 毎日 無重力空間で生活する― 良い点と悪い点は？

translation.en: Oh, look at this.
translation.ja: すごいですね

translation.en: That's magnificent.
translation.ja: 見事です

translation.en: [Doug] You can imagine that there's a lot of places, like going to the restroom, for example, where you like stuff to stay where you put it.
translation.ja: 例えばトイレに行く時は大変だったりしますよ

translation.en: And so, uh, we definitely find that frustrating at times.
translation.ja: 時々 ストレスを感じます

translation.en: Time to go.
translation.ja: いくよ

translation.en: You take the valve, and, uh…
translation.ja: バルブを手に取って…

translation.en: That's where your business goes.
translation.ja: こうやって吸引する

translation.en: [Doug] They have six crew quarters on board the space station,
translation.ja: ＩＳＳには６つのクルークォーターがあり

translation.en: and those crew quarters are really, really nice.
translation.ja: 居心地のいい個室です

translation.en: You've got your laptop in there. You've got your sleeping bag attached to a wall.
translation.ja: ノートパソコンや寝袋が壁に付いています

translation.en: [interviewer] Can you reach down and touch your toes?
translation.ja: つま先に触れます？

translation.en: You probably would have to fold your computer up,
translation.ja: パソコンを閉じれば

translation.en: and then you might be able to kind of do a sit-up,
translation.ja: 前屈はできるかもしれません

translation.en: uh, and not hit both walls.
translation.ja: 頭をぶつけずにね

translation.en: I mean, it's certainly not huge,
translation.ja: 広くはありませんが

translation.en: but it's actually kind of… kind of cozy, if… if I had to be honest.
translation.ja: 正直に言うとくつろげる空間ですよ

translation.en: [woman] What kind of liquids can you drink?
translation.ja: どんな飲料を飲みます？

translation.en: Is there a cocktail hour in space?
translation.ja: 宇宙にカクテルアワーは？

translation.en: Every hour is cocktail hour for, uh… for astronauts.
translation.ja: 宇宙飛行士には常にカクテルアワーですよ

translation.en: Because you can drink balls of fluid right out of the air like that.
translation.ja: 液体のボールを飲めますからね

translation.en: I don't know how many of these examples I wanna set for my son,
translation.ja: この姿を息子にも見せてやりたいな

translation.en: because he'll be playing with his food all day if he gets the chance to see something like this.
translation.ja: こんなものを見たら１日中 遊ぶだろうね

translation.en: Chicken.
translation.ja: チキンだ

translation.en: [Doug] We exercise for about two hours, uh, every day,
translation.ja: 毎日 ２時間ほど運動します

translation.en: with weight lifting and either running or cycling
translation.ja: 重量挙げやランニングで

translation.en: to maintain our health and our fitness for our return.
translation.ja: 帰還に向けて体力を維持します

translation.en: [Bob] Our heart, its most important job is to feed the brain oxygenated blood.
translation.ja: 心臓の重要な仕事は脳に酸素と血液を送ること

translation.en: And then when you take the gravity vector out of the picture,
translation.ja: しかし無重力空間では

translation.en: the heart sends too much up to the brain, and your head gets all puffed up.
translation.ja: 心臓が働きすぎてしまい頭がパンパンになります

translation.en: [Karen] The way your body adapts to weightlessness,
translation.ja: 体は無重力に慣れます

translation.en: I distinctly remember when I first got to space,
translation.ja: 初めて宇宙へ行った当初は

translation.en: every time I would flip upside down, I felt like I was upside down.
translation.ja: 頭を下に下げると逆さまの感覚でした

translation.en: And there was a moment where I was trying to hang my sleeping bag on the mid-deck wall,
translation.ja: しかし 寝袋を壁に取り付けようとした時に

translation.en: and, just like this, my mind completely changed.
translation.ja: 体の感覚が完全に変わりました

translation.en: And from that point on, I could be in any orientation, and I never felt like I was upside down.
translation.ja: それ以降はどんな向きでも逆さまだと感じませんでした

translation.en: It was so neat to me,
translation.ja: すてきな体験です

translation.en: the way your body and mind just switch like that.
translation.ja: 心も体も環境に慣れたのです

translation.en: [Bob] You feel congested because you still have all this extra volume in your head.
translation.ja: 宇宙では脳がうっ血状態になるので

translation.en: So your sense of smell and your sense of taste are dull.
translation.ja: 味覚や嗅覚が鈍ります

translation.en: We have every hot sauce known to humankind.
translation.ja: 刺激的なソースもあり

translation.en: You pour that on absolutely everything.
translation.ja: 何にでもかけて食べます

translation.en: [officer] I believe birthday wishes are in order, Bob. Is that true?
translation.ja: ボブ 間もなく誕生日ですね

translation.en: [Bob] That's true. I got to join the 50-year-old club, just like these two other guys.
translation.ja: 他の２人と同じくもうすぐ50代です

translation.en: They've been teasing me all day about it.
translation.ja: １日中 いじられた

translation.en: [officer] Yeah, I know it's not safe to put 50 candles on a cake
translation.ja: ろうそくはダメですが

translation.en: in a high-oxygen environment, but at least make everybody sing to you.
translation.ja: せめて誕生日ソングは歌ってくださいね 〝ミニケーキで50歳の誕生日祝い〞

translation.en: [Megan] Because I know so well what Bob is doing, I know he's working really hard.
translation.ja: ボブの努力はよく理解しています ボブの努力はよく理解しています〝ボブ誕生日おめでとう〞

translation.en: I've had those same experiences,
translation.ja: 〝ボブ誕生日おめでとう〞家族と離れるのはつらいはずです 家族と離れるのはつらいはずです

translation.en: and I know it's hard to be away from your family.
translation.ja: 家族と離れるのはつらいはずです〝チョコケーキを宇宙で楽しんで〞 〝チョコケーキを宇宙で楽しんで〞

translation.en: It was important to us to do something special.
translation.ja: 〝50歳〞 特別なことをしたかったのです

translation.en: That encouragement from home, I think, is really important, that we're thinking of him, that we know what he's doing is hard.
translation.ja: 家族からの理解や応援はとても重要だと思います

translation.en: You know, the work requires, you know, a lot of dedication,
translation.ja: 任務には献身的な姿勢や集中力が求められ

translation.en: a lot of focus, a lot of problem-solving, and always a lot of risk.
translation.ja: 任務には献身的な姿勢や集中力が求められ リスクも伴います

translation.en: Can you guys hear me?
translation.ja: 聞こえる？

translation.en: -Yeah, loud and clear. -[Doug] Okay.
translation.ja: はっきりね よし

translation.en: Check the PTT's off.
translation.ja: ＰＴＴはオフ

translation.en: Houston air lock on one.
translation.ja: ヒューストンこちらエアロック

translation.ja: 医療酸素の交換手続きが完了

translation.en: Going back to step 15 in 1.225.
translation.ja: 1.225のステップ15に戻る

translation.en: [Anna] Thanks, Doug, for working the setup so well.
translation.ja: ダグセットアップをありがとう

translation.en: Got us right on timeline. We appreciate it.
translation.ja: 予定の時刻どおりです

translation.ja: クリス ボブ おはよう

translation.en: -[Bob] Good morning. -[Chris] Good morning.
translation.ja: おはよう

translation.ja: それでは減圧します

translation.en: -[Chris] EV1 copies. -[Bob] EV2 copies.
translation.ja: ＥＶ１ 了解 ＥＶ２ 了解

translation.en: [Doug] To keep Space Station flying over the Earth, it's a constant maintenance program.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳは絶えずメンテナンスが必要です

translation.en: We do all these space walks to either add modules to the space station when we were building it.
translation.ja: 船外活動ではＩＳＳにモジュールを取り付けるか

translation.en: And now it's to replace pieces of equipment that either are getting old or that fail.
translation.ja: 古い もしくは故障した部品を取り替えます

translation.en: Our mission is essentially to upgrade the batteries.
translation.ja: 私たちの任務はバッテリーのアップグレードです

translation.en: You know, the power of the space station is maintained by the battery system.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳの電力はバッテリーで動いています

translation.en: Through the solar arrays, the batteries are recharged.
translation.ja: ソーラーパネルで充電されます

translation.en: And so just like a rechargeable battery at home, after many years of these cycles,
translation.ja: 家庭用の充電式バッテリーと同じです

translation.en: and then of course the hot and cold of being in space between daylight and darkness, those batteries wear out.
translation.ja: 長年 日夜の気温差にさらされ 消耗するのです

translation.en: It's a big job, because these batteries are like 400 pounds apiece.
translation.ja: 重さは１つ約180キロもあります

translation.en: Fortunately, we got both Bob and Chris,
translation.ja: 幸い ボブとクリスは

translation.en: two of our best spacewalkers.
translation.ja: 船外活動が大得意です

translation.en: -Doing good? -[Bob] Yeah.
translation.ja: 大丈夫？ ああ

translation.en: During my first two missions, I did six space walks
translation.ja: 過去６回の船外活動では

translation.en: associated with the construction of the space station.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳ組み立てに関わりました

translation.en: But even though I've done it a couple of times, it doesn't get easy for me.
translation.ja: しかし何度 経験しても簡単ではありません

translation.en: You know, there's a lot of pressure in a situation like that,
translation.ja: プレッシャーが重くのしかかります

translation.en: that, uh, if you don't do your job, uh, successfully,
translation.ja: プレッシャーが重くのしかかります 失敗すれば 宇宙を漂流する可能性もあります

translation.en: I could float off into space.
translation.ja: 宇宙を漂流する可能性もあります

translation.en: You have to compartmentalize and take deep breaths
translation.ja: 深呼吸して自分のペースを保ち

translation.en: so that you can pace yourself and stay focused in the face of this daunting task.
translation.ja: 集中力を維持することで困難な仕事に対処します

translation.ja: クルーロックの減圧準備完了

translation.ja: 減圧ポンプの電源を“オン”にする

translation.ja: 了解 減圧ボタンをオンに

translation.ja: 幸運を祈る

translation.ja: ボブは 船外の2075の手すりを

translation.ja: 了解 2075だな

translation.ja: 約３分半後です

translation.en: -[Bob] Sun. -[Chris] Here comes the sun again.
translation.ja: 太陽だ また夜明けだ

translation.ja: 間もなくカリフォルニア沿岸です

translation.en: If you look south, you might see Hawthorne.
translation.ja: 南側にホーソーンが見えます

translation.ja: ボブ バッテリー１を？

translation.en: [Bob] Let's go to battery three first.
translation.ja: まずはバッテリー３からだ

translation.en: [Anna] You'll be going to H1. Confirm socket tape line flush.
translation.ja: Ｈ１の点滅を確認して

translation.ja: ８回転してバッテリーの解放を

translation.ja: 制御できてる？

translation.ja: できてるよ

translation.en: [Doug] Okay, copy that.
translation.ja: 了解

translation.en: Looks good, guys.
translation.ja: 順調だ

translation.ja: ボブ 準備ができたらいくつか警告が

translation.ja: ブラーヴォ７のトルクの設定の不具合で

translation.ja: 鋭利な破片やシャンクの故障が想定できます

translation.en: How copy?

translation.ja: 全部 了解

translation.en: Is there any good news about this?
translation.ja: いい知らせは？

translation.ja: 怖そうだ　本当にやる？

translation.en: -[Bob] Obviously. -[Chris] Obviously.
translation.ja: もちろん そうか

translation.en: [Bob] It looks equal to me on both sides.
translation.ja: 平行に見える

translation.en: [Chris] I agree.
translation.ja: 僕もだ

translation.en: In the indicator, those locked.
translation.ja: ロックされたようだ

translation.en: [Anna] Copy, such a good install.
translation.ja: 了解です

translation.en: Just a heads-up, you're going into a day pass in about a minute.
translation.ja: ちなみにあと１分で日の出です

translation.en: [Bob] How about a picture?
translation.ja: 写真 撮る？

translation.en: It's a good location, good time.
translation.ja: 場所もタイミングもいい

translation.en: [Chris] Yeah.
translation.ja: ああ

translation.ja: 次 いつ日没か分からないから

translation.en: [Chris] Yeah, that's good.
translation.ja: いい案だ

translation.en: [Bob] To see the wondrous events that are happening
translation.ja: 宇宙遊泳中は何度も

translation.en: as you go through a space walk, there's sunrises and sunsets,
translation.ja: 夜明けや日没があります

translation.en: you realize, you know, our world is precious,
translation.ja: 世界の貴重さや

translation.en: and you start having appreciation for how little you actually are.
translation.ja: 自分の存在の小ささに気づきます

translation.en: And I think every astronaut kind of feels the same way.
translation.ja: 宇宙飛行士なら同じように感じるでしょう

translation.en: [Megan] As you go around the Earth, you don't see the lines and the borders that are drawn on maps.
translation.ja: 地球に地図上の国境は見えません

translation.en: You see the Earth as this one entity, and it's our home.
translation.ja: 地球は１つの存在で私たちの故郷です

translation.en: You sense its fragility in this sort of vast blackness of space and this very thin atmosphere
translation.ja: 宇宙の広大な闇と私たちを守る薄い大気層の

translation.en: that's what's keeping us all safe.
translation.ja: はかなさを感じます

translation.en: You feel very protective, I think,
translation.ja: 守られている感覚と

translation.en: and you feel a very strong connection.
translation.ja: 強いつながりを感じます

translation.en: [Doug] Even the most hardened, cynical astronauts, you know,
translation.ja: どんなにひねくれた宇宙飛行士でさえ

translation.en: once they've gone to space, it's changed them and for the better.
translation.ja: 宇宙に行けば変わります

translation.en: You know, you look down, and you go, "We're all on this little ball."

translation.en: And then you look back into space

translation.en: and get this overwhelming sense of, you know, the things we're gonna do next.

translation.ja: おかえりなさい

translation.ja: 〝月面の米国人〞 〝月面の米国人〞 月面着陸は

translation.en: is singularly the most dramatic event in the history of humanity.
translation.ja: 人類史上 最も劇的な出来事です

translation.en: And so this is the leftovers, basically. [laughs]

translation.ja: 子どもの頃に見たんだ

translation.en: This is pretty crazy.
translation.ja: すごいな

translation.en: [Bala] Like the size of that gas generator, it almost looks like the size of our thrust chamber.

translation.en: -[Hans] Exactly. -[laughing]
translation.ja: 本当だな

translation.en: [Hans] Yeah, it's huge.
translation.ja: 巨大だね

translation.en: This is the most powerful rocket that had been built up to date.
translation.ja: これまでで最も強力なロケットだ

translation.en: [Bala] Yeah, you just need that energy to get--

translation.en: To the Moon.
translation.ja: 月までね

translation.en: -Or to Mars. -Mars, so… [chuckles]
translation.ja: もしくは火星

translation.en: The other thing to recognize is, like, this was all like new stuff
translation.ja: 当時はあまり飛行経験もなく

translation.en: that they had made and, like, didn't have much flight experience on.
translation.ja: 当時はあまり飛行経験もなく どれも新技術だった

translation.en: I mean, we have, like, 80-something flights. And we're slowly getting into those flights.
translation.ja: 私たちは80回ほど試験して少しずつだ

translation.en: Only now are we confident enough to put Bob and Doug in there. [laughs]
translation.ja: ようやくボブとダグを乗せられる

translation.en: And they tested it twice and said, "Okay, you guys go in there." [laughs]
translation.ja: 当時の無人試験はたった２回

translation.en: Yeah.
translation.ja: だね

translation.en: All right, let's go one step further.
translation.ja: もう少し進もう

translation.en: -That's the lunar lander. -[Bala] Yeah.
translation.ja: 月着陸船だ

translation.en: It looks small, actually.
translation.ja: 小さく見える

translation.en: -I wanna see that inside. -[Bala] Yeah.
translation.ja: 中が見たい

translation.en: They'd be standing up in there, basically.
translation.ja: 中で立つんだよね

translation.en: There's no… no chair or anything.
translation.ja: いすも何もない

translation.en: [Bala] Yeah, and this had the rudiments of digital computers in there.
translation.ja: デジタルコンピューターの初期段階だ

translation.en: [Hans] I mean, a computer on this thing, I don't think there's anything comparable that we have.
translation.ja: 現代と比較できる物が思い浮かばない

translation.en: -A car key is probably smarter. -Yeah.
translation.ja: 車の鍵の方がスマートだ

translation.en: But, I mean, they made it work.
translation.ja: だが当時はうまくいった

translation.en: -I mean, that's the main thing. -That's the fascinating thing.
translation.ja: だが当時はうまくいった すごいよね

translation.en: Even more dramatic when you think that what they had in terms of electronics to make that work.
translation.ja: 当時の技術で電子機器を動かしていたんだ

translation.en: Yeah.
translation.ja: ああ

translation.en: [Hans] Pretty inspiring coming back here and just looking at it.
translation.ja: ここに来るとやる気が出る

translation.en: Now that we've shown that we can fly astronauts…
translation.ja: 宇宙飛行士を宇宙に送れました

translation.en: …it's time to go back to the Moon with astronauts again for a longer time
translation.ja: 今度はもう一度人類を月に送り

translation.en: and extend our range to Mars.
translation.ja: 火星まで範囲を広げる時です

translation.en: [Elon] These super smart, super talented people, they believe in the goal.
translation.ja: 超優秀な彼らがゴールを信じています

translation.en: A base on the Moon and a city on Mars can happen.
translation.ja: 月基地と火星都市は実現可能です

translation.en: I was not sure whether such a path existed before. Now I am confident that such a path exists.
translation.ja: 以前は信じられなかった道が目の前にあるのです

translation.en: But first, we got a real important mission tomorrow.
translation.ja: その前に明日は大事なミッションです

translation.en: [officer] Good morning, Bob and Doug.
translation.ja: ＩＳＳ搭乗62日目おはよう ＩＳＳ搭乗62日目

translation.ja: ＩＳＳ搭乗62日目今日は特別なメッセージが 今日は特別なメッセージが

translation.en: [Theo] Rise and shine, Daddy. We love you.
translation.ja: パパ 朝だよ！　愛してる

translation.en: We can't wait to see you. Wake up, wake up!
translation.ja: 会えるのが楽しみ早く起きて

translation.en: [Jack] I'm happy you went into space, but I'm even happier that you're coming back home.

translation.en: [Theo] Hurry home so we can go get my dog.
translation.ja: 帰ってきたら犬の散歩に行こう

translation.en: [Jack] We love you, Dad.
translation.ja: パパ 大好き

translation.en: [Bob] We're about to embark on the final portion of the journey.
translation.ja: いよいよ 旅の最終段階です

translation.en: And as I look forward to heading back home,
translation.ja: 家に帰るのが楽しみです

translation.en: my son and Doug's son are really excited not only to get their fathers back
translation.ja: 私たちの息子たちは父の帰還だけでなく

translation.en: but to get our Apatosaurus, our zero-G indicator, that they nominated to go with us.
translation.ja: この恐竜の帰りも楽しみにしているでしょう

translation.en: And so for Jack and Theo,
translation.ja: ジャックとテオ

translation.en: uh, Tremor the Apatosaurus is, uh, headed home soon.
translation.ja: トレマーはもうすぐ帰るよ

translation.en: [Megan] Reentry is obviously the next big milestone,
translation.ja: 大気圏への再突入は重要な節目なので

translation.ja: 大気圏への再突入は重要な節目なので 失敗は許されません

translation.en: [Anna] Dragon, SpaceX. Comm check.
translation.ja: ドラゴン 通信確認を

translation.ja: スペースＸ 確認地上へ帰る

translation.en: [Megan] It's hard to prepare yourself. You don't know exactly what you're gonna feel.
translation.ja: 覚悟を決めるのは難しいことです

translation.en: But there's a part of you that can't let go
translation.ja: 心のどこかで何か問題が起こるかもと

translation.en: of that sort of, you know, hopefully irrational fear
translation.ja: 心のどこかで何か問題が起こるかもと 恐怖を抱えています

translation.en: that something could go wrong.
translation.ja: 恐怖を抱えています

translation.en: [Anna] The final reconfigurations for undock are complete and nominal.
translation.ja: ドッキング解除の最終段階は順調です

translation.en: [Megan] Am I gonna be nervous? Absolutely.
translation.ja: 確実に緊張します

translation.en: But I want my son to experience the joy and excitement of that moment
translation.ja: ですが息子には喜びを感じてほしいので

translation.en: and try to keep all of the… the nervousness to myself.
translation.ja: 緊張を抑えたいと思います

translation.ja: ドッキング解除 開始

translation.en: Please confirm your visors are down
translation.ja: バイザーを閉じ

translation.en: and that you are ready for undock and departure.
translation.ja: 出発の準備を

translation.ja: バイザーを閉じ 準備完了だ

translation.en: [Anna] Dragon, SpaceX. Separation confirmed.
translation.ja: ドラゴン スペースＸ分離を確認

translation.en: [Chris] Endeavour, Station. Bob and Doug, it's been an honor to serve with you.
translation.ja: ボブとダグ君たちと働けて光栄だ

translation.en: Safe travels and have a successful landing.
translation.ja: 安全な旅と無事な着陸を祈る

translation.en: Godspeed.
translation.ja: 神のご加護を

translation.en: Endeavour copies all. Thanks, Chris.
translation.ja: ありがとう クリス

translation.en: Bob and I, we're just excited to get back home.
translation.ja: ボブと私は帰還が楽しみでした

translation.en: But you can never let your guard down, especially on a first flight.
translation.ja: しかし油断は禁物です

translation.en: You know, you really have to do the whole mission end to end.
translation.ja: 最後まで任務を遂行します

translation.en: There was a time when we thought, "Well, we just get through the ascent, and we'll be fine."

translation.en: We can only hope that what we're seeing is not the worst.

translation.en: and that they were, you know, gonna do the best they could,

translation.en: but when the vehicle broke up at 200, 250,000 feet,

translation.en: that it's not likely that anybody survived.
translation.ja: 生存は無理でしょう

translation.en: Just seeing the pieces of Columbia,
translation.ja: コロンビア号の部品や

translation.en: pieces of the crew module and helmets and those kinds of things,
translation.ja: 搭乗員のヘルメットなどを見ました

translation.en: you know, that… that leaves an impression that I think you never ever…
translation.ja: 今でもそれらのことが印象に残り

translation.en: you never really get over.

translation.en: When you lose a rocket with a payload on it, that is a bad situation.
translation.ja: 積み荷を乗せたロケットの事故も問題ですが

translation.en: But if you lose a rocket with a crew on it, that… that is an order of magnitude different.
translation.ja: 有人ロケットの事故は話の次元が違います

translation.en: And in the end, you don't want anybody to ever have to go through that again.

translation.en: [Kiko] We have been preparing for Bob and Doug to come home.

translation.en: You know, as soon as that capsule released, uh, and we undocked,

translation.en: the nerves popped up again, the general feeling of like, "Oh man, we're in free flight."

translation.en: That's a thrust maneuver that reduces your velocity so that you start descending

translation.ja: 世界も新時代とみなすでしょう

translation.en: We're gonna have a base on the Moon, and we're gonna have… send people to Mars.
translation.ja: 月基地を作り火星にも人を送り

translation.en: Have… and make life multi-planetary.
translation.ja: 多惑星化します

translation.en: And I think this… this day heralds a new age of space exploration.
translation.ja: 今日から宇宙開発の新時代の幕開けです

translation.en: [woman 1] You're looking at the Crew Dragon spacecraft and Falcon 9 rocket
translation.ja: こちらはクルードラゴンとファルコン９ロケット

translation.en: set to launch four astronauts to the International Space Station
translation.ja: ４人を乗せてＩＳＳに向かい ６ヶ月のミッションに挑みます

translation.en: on a six-month science mission.
translation.ja: ６ヶ月のミッションに挑みます

translation.en: This crew is about to fly in the exact same capsule
translation.ja: ボブとダグが昨年のＤｅｍｏ２で乗ったのと

translation.en: that first flew NASA astronauts Bob Behnken and Doug Hurley
translation.ja: ボブとダグが昨年のＤｅｍｏ２で乗ったのと 同じカプセルが今回も使われます

translation.en: in last year's Demo-2 test flight.
translation.ja: 同じカプセルが今回も使われます

translation.en: This is the second crew to fly on a commercial spacecraft
translation.ja: 有人宇宙飛行の新時代における

translation.en: for this new era of human spaceflight.
translation.ja: ２度目の民間宇宙飛行です

translation.en: [woman 1] And here they come, the Crew-2 astronauts
translation.ja: ２号機の乗組員たちが

translation.en: taking their first steps outside before their journey to space.
translation.ja: 宇宙の旅に出る前の最初の一歩を踏み出します

translation.en: [man] Yay!
translation.ja: 頑張れ！

translation.en: [Theo] Hey, Mommy!
translation.ja: ママ！

translation.en: [woman 1] Pilot Megan McArthur in the front.
translation.ja: 先頭はメーガン･マッカーサー

translation.en: Hi, buddy!
translation.ja: 来たのね

translation.en: [Theo] Hey, Mommy, I love you.
translation.ja: ママ 愛してる

translation.en: [woman 2] Looks like Bob Behnken is there with their son.
translation.ja: ボブ･ベンケンが息子といます

translation.en: They are a power couple, and I love it. [laughs]
translation.ja: パワーカップルですね

translation.en: [Bob] Now it's time for Megan's mission.
translation.ja: 今度はメーガンの番です

translation.en: It's super exciting for us that she's gonna be able to ride the same Dragon capsule.
translation.ja: 彼女も同じドラゴンに乗れてうれしいです

translation.en: And so I need to step in in the backup role
translation.ja: 今度は僕がサポート役になり

translation.en: and flip-flop and make sure our son Theo gets everything he needs.
translation.ja: 今度は僕がサポート役になり テオのそばにいます

translation.en: [Theo] See you in six months.
translation.ja: またね

translation.en: See you in six months. I'm gonna miss you.
translation.ja: 半年後ね 寂しくなる

translation.en: [Megan] My husband flew the Crew Dragon last year and happened to be in the same seat that I'll be in.
translation.ja: 昨年 夫が座ったのと同じ席に私が座ります

translation.en: This time it's Mom's turn, and I'm gonna be up there for six months.
translation.ja: 今度はママの番６ヶ月のミッションです

translation.en: [Megan] As our son gets older, he's starting to build an awareness of what it is that we do.
translation.ja: 息子は成長するにつれ親の仕事を理解し始めました

translation.en: We want him to understand
translation.ja: 私たちは探求を続け

translation.en: we think it's important to explore and to push the boundaries
translation.ja: 私たちは探求を続け 人類の可能性を広げています

translation.en: of what we're capable of.
translation.ja: 人類の可能性を広げています

translation.en: [woman 1] The crew now on their way to Launch Complex 39A,
translation.ja: 乗組員が発射台39Ａに向かいます

translation.en: ready for their ride to the space station.
translation.ja: いよいよＩＳＳへ飛びます

translation.en: I embrace this dawn of this age of commercialization of space.
translation.ja: 私は宇宙の商業化の新時代を受け入れます

translation.en: Our mission proved that we could get humans in the low Earth orbit
translation.ja: 私たちの任務が成功したことで

translation.en: and kind of planted the seed for how we're gonna go beyond that.
translation.ja: その先の未来も開けたはずです

translation.en: [Bob] As we go forward, we wanna accomplish all those missions
translation.ja: 宇宙開発のため今後もあらゆるミッションを

translation.en: that help us understand what's out there,
translation.ja: 成功させたいです

translation.en: but at the same time,
translation.ja: ですが同時に

translation.en: we have to figure out the smart way to take care of the resources and our solar system
translation.ja: 地球の資源と太陽系を守らなければなりません

translation.en: and not trash Mars when the opportunity presents itself.
translation.ja: 火星移住時も大事にすべきです

translation.en: [Doug] Of course, there will be questions and challenges,
translation.ja: もちろん疑問や課題もあります

translation.en: like how we're gonna govern something like that.
translation.ja: 統治はどうするかなど

translation.en: But if we can continue to get people into space,
translation.ja: ですが人を宇宙に送り続ければ

translation.en: I can't imagine it doesn't make us better.
translation.ja: 明るい未来があるはず

translation.en: [officer] Elon, are you go?
translation.ja: イーロン 許可を？

translation.en: [Elon] Absolutely.
translation.ja: もちろん

translation.en: [officer] MJ, we're here. We just spoke to Elon. He's ready to go.
translation.ja: ＭＪイーロンの許可が下りた

translation.en: [Elon] We should think more about, what's the future we want?
translation.ja: 理想の未来を考えるべきです

translation.en: What has the happy ending?
translation.ja: ハッピーエンドは？

translation.en: For me, it's, you know, making sure we become a spacefaring civilization.
translation.ja: 僕が望むのは宇宙文明の開拓です

translation.en: [officer] Dragon, SpaceX. You are go for launch.
translation.ja: ドラゴン 打ち上げ開始

translation.en: [Elon] But it's very important to appreciate this is not inevitable.
translation.ja: しかし努力が必要です

translation.en: People are mistaken when they think that technology just automatically improves.
translation.ja: 科学技術が自動的に進歩するという考えは

translation.en: It does not automatically improve.
translation.ja: 大間違いです

translation.en: If you look at great civilizations like ancient Egypt,
translation.ja: 古代エジプトのピラミッドの作り方を

translation.en: and they were able to make the pyramids, and they forgot how to do that.
translation.ja: 古代エジプトのピラミッドの作り方を 人々は忘れました

translation.en: And the Romans, they built these incredible aqueducts. They forgot how to do it.
translation.ja: 古代ローマの水道技術も失われました

translation.en: In 1969, we were able to send somebody to the Moon,
translation.ja: 1969年人類は月へ行ったのに

translation.en: and we forgot how to do that.
translation.ja: その方法も忘れました

translation.en: [officer 1] T-minus 15 seconds.
translation.ja: 発射15秒前

translation.en: [Elon] The window of opportunity is open right now to make life multi-planetary.
translation.ja: 今こそ多惑星種になるチャンスです

translation.en: But we cannot count on it being open for a long time.
translation.ja: 逃してはなりません

translation.en: [officer 1] Ten, nine, eight, seven…
translation.ja: 逃してはなりません 10 ９ ８ ７…

translation.en: [Elon] We need to take advantage of that window while it is open.
translation.ja: チャンスがあるうちに挑戦するのです

translation.en: [officer 1] …four, three, two, one.
[officer 2] Endeavour launches once again.
translation.ja: エンデバー２度目の打ち上げ

translation.en: Four astronauts from three countries on Crew-2
translation.ja: ４ヶ国から３人の宇宙飛行士が

translation.en: now making their way to the one and only International Space Station.
translation.ja: 国際宇宙ステーションへ向かいます

translation.en: [officer 3] Crew Dragon flying free.
translation.ja: ドラゴン宇宙に入りました
